schemes.name: PM-KISAN Samman Nidhi
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
schemes.objective: To provide income support to farmer families to supplement their financial needs for procuring various inputs related to agriculture and allied activities as well as domestic needs.

benefits.description: ₹6,000 per year in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each

eligibility: Small and marginal farmers holding cultivable land up to 2 hectares
Farmer families who own cultivable land as per land records
Both landowner farmers and tenant farmers are eligible
exclusions: Farmer families with any family member as serving/retired government employee
applicationProcess: Visit PM-KISAN portal or CSC center
Fill the application form with required details
Receive payment via Direct Benefit Transfer

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G)
schemes.objective: To provide pucca houses with basic amenities to all houseless and those living in dilapidated/kutcha houses in rural areas by 2022.

benefits.description: ₹1.20 lakh assistance for construction of houses in plain areas
₹1.30 lakh assistance for construction of houses in hilly/difficult areas
90 days of unskilled manual labor under MGNREGA

eligibility: Houseless households and those living in zero, one or two room kutcha houses
Households with no adult member between 16-59 years
Female-headed households with no adult male member
Households with disabled members and no able-bodied adult member

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana (PMUY)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
schemes.objective: To provide LPG connections to women from Below Poverty Line households to reduce their dependence on traditional cooking fuels and protect their health.

benefits.description: Free LPG connection with gas stove, pressure regulator, safety hose, and instruction booklet
Deposit-free LPG connection (worth ₹1,600)

eligibility: Women whose names are in SECC-2011 database
AY, PHH, AAY, and other priority households
applicationProcess: Fill KYC form with required documents
First refill subsidized under the scheme

schemes.name: Post Matric Scholarship for SC Students
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
schemes.objective: To provide financial assistance to SC students for pursuing post-matriculation studies to enable them to pursue higher education.

benefits.description: ₹230 per month maintenance allowance for day scholars
₹380 per month maintenance allowance for hostellers
Reimbursement of tuition fees and other compulsory fees

eligibility: Annual family income not exceeding ₹2.5 lakh
applicationProcess: Apply online through National Scholarship Portal

schemes.name: Post Matric Scholarship for OBC Students
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
schemes.objective: To provide financial assistance to OBC students for pursuing post-matriculation studies and encourage higher education among OBC communities.

benefits.description: ₹230 per month maintenance allowance for day scholars
₹380 per month maintenance allowance for hostellers
Reimbursement of tuition fees up to specified limits

eligibility: Students belonging to Other Backward Classes (OBC)
Annual family income not exceeding ₹1 lakh

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri MUDRA Yojana
schemes.objective: To provide funding to micro-enterprises and small business units to promote entrepreneurship and self-employment.

benefits.description: Shishu loans up to ₹50,000
Kishore loans ₹50,000 to ₹5 lakh
Tarun loans ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh

schemes.name: Ayushman Bharat - Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (AB-PMJAY)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
schemes.objective: To provide health insurance coverage to poor and vulnerable families for secondary and tertiary hospitalization.

benefits.description: ₹5 lakh health insurance cover per family per year
Cashless treatment at empaneled hospitals
Coverage for pre and post hospitalization expenses

eligibility: Rural families with specific occupation and deprivation criteria
Urban families based on 11 pre-defined occupational criteria
applicationProcess: Check eligibility through website or helpline
schemes.coverage: All states except Delhi and Odisha

schemes.name: National Old Age Pension Scheme (NOAPS)
schemes.objective: To provide financial assistance to destitute senior citizens to improve their quality of life and ensure basic livelihood security.

benefits.description: ₹500 per month pension (states may provide additional amount)

eligibility: Belonging to households below poverty line
Having little or no regular source of income
Not receiving pension under any other government scheme
applicationProcess: Pension credited monthly to bank account

schemes.name: National Disability Pension Scheme (NDPS)
schemes.objective: To provide pension to persons with disabilities belonging to BPL households to ensure their basic livelihood security.

benefits.description: ₹500 per month pension (states may provide additional amount)

eligibility: Persons with disabilities aged 18 years and above
Belonging to households below poverty line
Not receiving pension under any other scheme

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
schemes.objective: To enable youth to take up industry-relevant skill training that will help them secure a sustainable livelihood.

benefits.description: Average monetary reward of ₹8,000 on successful completion of training
Free skill development training
Government certification on successful completion
Placement assistance

eligibility: Preference to youth from economically weaker sections
applicationProcess: Appear for assessment and get certified

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana
schemes.objective: To ensure financial inclusion by providing access to banking services, remittance and insurance to the unbanked.

benefits.description: Zero balance bank account with RuPay debit card
₹2 lakh accident insurance cover
₹30,000 life insurance cover (with certain conditions)
Overdraft facility up to ₹10,000

eligibility: Indian citizens aged 18 years and above
Priority to women, SC/ST, and minorities

schemes.name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
schemes.objective: To provide at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment per year to every rural household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work.

benefits.description: Minimum wage of ₹309 per day (varies by state)
100 days guaranteed employment per household
Work within 5 km radius or transport allowance

eligibility: Adult members willing to do unskilled manual work
applicationProcess: Apply for job card at gram panchayat

schemes.name: Beti Bachao Beti Padhao
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
schemes.objective: To address the declining Child Sex Ratio and create an enabling environment for empowerment of girls and women.

benefits.description: Financial incentives for girl child education
Awareness campaigns for gender equality
Support for higher education of girls

eligibility: Focus on districts with poor Child Sex Ratio

schemes.name: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
schemes.objective: To encourage savings for girl child education and marriage expenses through attractive interest rates.

benefits.description: 7.6% annual interest rate (tax-free)
Tax deduction up to ₹1.5 lakh under Section 80C
21-year maturity period with partial withdrawal allowed

applicationProcess: Visit post office or authorized bank

schemes.name: Jal Jeevan Mission
schemes.objective: To provide functional household tap connection to every rural household by 2024.

benefits.description: 55 liters per person per day water supply
Functional household tap connection
Quality water testing facilities

ministries: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
